Late wonder strike rescues Halifax

A stunning 25-yard volley from man of the match Ed Henry secured Halifax a 3-3 draw with the last kick of the game in Sunday's clash with Wentworth on 22 Acres

Rous-Ross punishes Langwith

Vanbrugh routed their Langwith opponents 4-1 on 22 Acres on Sunday morning. A brace from Elliot Rous-Ross sealed victory for Vanbrugh after a solid all round performance from the men in blue and red

Dubious Belshaw penalty seals points for Derwent

Dave Belshaw scored a dramatic late winner from the penalty spot, as Derwent overcame James in a tight match on 22 Acres on Sunday morning

James claim college netball title

James emerged victorious in the Sports Tent on Sunday to take the college netball crown for the Spring Term after beating Derwent 23-8

York looking to end BUCS season on high

With York's clubs coming to end of their BUCS seasons, there is still much to be played for this Wednesday

ECB must learn from Maynard tragedy

The tragic results of this week's inquest into the death of the talented and promising Tom Maynard brought to light two different issues

Volleyball victory in heated Newcastle clash

The White Rose recorded a comprehensive whitewash against Newcastle in a fiery encounter on and off the court at the Sports Hall as the visitors fell afoul of some tenuous refereeing decisions

Lacklustre UYRUFC grind out narrow Hull win

A slow and lethargic performance from the UYRUFC was just about to enough to squeeze past 31-29 against a feisty Hull side and keep them in the hunt for promotion on Wednesday afternoon

Men's firsts slip further away from promotion

Despite Sheffield forfeiting two of their doubles matches, York were unable to find the win that would see them leap-frog their opposing league leaders in a bid for promotion

Women's basketball lose to league leaders

York's women's basketballers lost today to league leaders Leeds Metropolitan seconds despite a brave and solid team performance. York kept their rivals in their sights for the entirety of the first three quarters but eventually Leeds Met proved their title credentials to take the game out of sight for the York players

Last-gasp Davies goal snatches point for UYAFC

A last-minute stunner from James Davies grabbed a 2-2 draw for the men's football firsts against Leeds Met this afternoon, keeping them in the hunt for promotion

Drop Ashton? Don't be Hasty...

Following England's Six Nations win over France, Harry Hawkins argues that the criticism of Chris Ashton is unjustified

Football thirds hit five to secure promotion

The men's football thirds secured promotion this afternoon with a dominant 5-0 demolition of their Sunderland counterparts

Derwent denied as Taylor scores winner

Goals from Kieran O'Dwyer and Phil Taylor helped Vanbrugh hold off rivals Derwent in a spirited encounter on 22 Acres

Women's football reach cup final after appeal

The women's football team have reached the final of the BUCS Northern Conference Cup, after the result from their semi final last week was overturned on appeal

Futsal firsts into national semi finals with Middlesex win

The futsal firsts' remarkable run continued tonight as they put in a spectacular performance to beat Middlesex 10-5 and reach the last four of the BUCS national championships

Harrison stars for York in darts championships

Ex-York student Alex Harrison was the star performer in this weekend's UDUK Big Darts Weekender, claiming the UK University Singles Championship for the second year running

Dominant Derwent claim College Rugby 10s title

Derwent College cemented their place as college rugby's premier side, as they romped to a dominant victory in today's 10s tournament

Halifax back to winning ways

Halifax earned their first college football win of the year with a 2-0 triumph over Langwith on the 3G pitch this morning

Davies brace hands James victory

A brace of goals from James Davies gave James College a 2-0 victory over Alcuin on a brisk 22 Acres this morning

Tracking the Future

In the midst of the track cycling world championships, Beth Jakubowski looks ahead to Rio 2016 and who will be looking to book their place amongst a team of glittering Olympic champions

Women's rugby beaten by organised Sheffield

The women's rugby firsts fell to a hard defeat at the hands of a very well-drilled and organised Sheffield side today

York's footballers fall agonisingly short of cup final

York's women's footballers fell to an agonising defeat in their semi-final today. York played some impressive football with standout performances from Marte Wang and Maria Davies in particular

Women's fencing out in quarter finals

The women's fencing team were today knocked out of the BUCS Championship by an impressive Cardiff outfit

Hull claim Varsity trophy after shooting win

York's clay pigeon shooting club were unable to retain the Varsity trophy for York as they came up against one of the country's finest university shooting teams at Hull's regular shooting range near Scunthorpe

Women's badminton in Varsity rout

The sole badminton women's team at Varsity were able to replicate the score-line of the men's seconds team as they helped York earn three vital points in the tournament

Net cord gives men's badminton firsts draw

After drawing with Hull's firsts team twice already this season, the men's badminton firsts could only repeat the result for a third time at Varsity, courtesy of Andrew Henderson shot that happened to fall on the right side of the net cord and saved the White Rose at the last

Football seconds in dramatic Varsity win

York men's football seconds secured victory over home side Hull in dramatic fashion at Varsity 2013

Football fourths clash completes Varsity whitewash

Johnny Grout's fourths side rounded off a fantastic day at Varsity 2013 for York football by hammering their Humberside opponents in this fixture

Men's badminton seconds claim easy win

The badminton men's seconds team put valuable points on the table for York at Varsity as they cruised to a comprehensive victory as Hull struggled to put up a fight
